pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:2.1: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:3.1: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:5.1: 66. The second training rule on married girls
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:6.2: At that time the nuns gave the full ordination to married girls who were more than twelve years old, but who had not trained for two years in the six rules.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:6.3: They were ignorant and incompetent, and they did not know what was allowable and what was not.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:7.1: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:7.3: “How can nuns give the full ordination to married girls who are more than twelve years old, but who have not trained for two years in the six rules?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:7.4: “Is it true, monks, that nuns do this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:7.7: How can the nuns give the full ordination to married girls who are more than twelve years old, but who have not trained for two years in the six rules?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:7.8: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:7.9: and after criticizing them … he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:7.10: “Monks, I allow giving approval to a married girl who is more than twelve years old to train in the six rules for two years.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:7.11: And it is to be given in this way.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:7.12: After approaching the Order of nuns, that married girl who is more than twelve years old should put her upper robe over one shoulder and pay respect at the feet of the nuns. She should then squat on her heels, put the palms of her hands together, and say,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:7.13: ‘Venerables, I, so-and-so, a married girl who is more than twelve years old, am training under Venerable so-and-so. I ask the Order for approval to train for two years in the six rules.’
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:7.14: And she should ask a second
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:7.16: A competent and capable nun should then inform the Order:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:8.1: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Order to listen.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:8.2: This married girl so-and-so, who is more than twelve years old and training under Venerable so-and-so, is asking the Order for approval to train in the six rules for two years.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:8.3: If it seems appropriate to the Order, the Order should give approval to this married girl so-and-so, who is more than twelve years old, to train in the six rules for two years.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:9.1: Please, Venerables, I ask the Order to listen.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:9.2: This married girl so-and-so, who is more than twelve years old and training under Venerable so-and-so, is asking the Order for approval to train in the six rules for two years.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:9.3: The Order gives approval to this married girl so-and-so, who is more than twelve years old, to train in the six rules for two years.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:9.4: Any nun who approves of giving approval to this married girl so-and-so, who is more than twelve years old, to train in the six rules for two years should remain silent.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:9.5: Any nun who does not approve should speak up.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:10.1: The Order has given approval to this married girl so-and-so, who is more than twelve years old, to train in the six rules for two years.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:10.2: The Order approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:11.1: That married girl, who is more than twelve years old, should be told to say this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:11.2: ‘I undertake to abstain from killing living beings for two years without transgression. …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:11.3: I undertake to abstain from eating at the wrong time for two years without transgression.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:12.1: Then, after criticizing those nuns in many ways for being difficult to support …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:12.2: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:13.1: ‘If a nun gives the full ordination to a married girl who is more than twelve years old, but who has not trained in the six rules for two years, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:14.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Orders through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:15.1: Who is more than twelve years old:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:15.2: who has reached twelve years of age.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:15.4: one who has gone to the place of a man is what is meant.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:15.8: the training has not been given to her, or the training has been given to her, but she has failed in it.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:16.1: If, intending to give the full ordination, she searches for a group, a teacher, a bowl, or a robe, or she establishes a boundary, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:16.2: After the motion, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:16.3: After each of the first two announcements, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:16.4: When the last announcement is finished, the preceptor commits an offense entailing confession;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:16.5: the group and the teacher commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:17.1: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as legitimate, and she gives the full ordination, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:17.2: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure if it is, and she gives the full ordination, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:17.3: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as illegitimate, and she gives the full ordination, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:18.1: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as legitimate, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:18.2: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure if it is, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:18.3: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as illegitimate, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:19.2: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc66:20.1: The sixth training rule is finished.
